title: index
content: Welcome This is the site for a notsosecret seminar on mathematics organized by a couple of secondyear math CS students at the University of Waterloo We meet every Friday

title: Upcoming Talks
content: Topic Speaker Location Time Talks on Friday October 7 2016 Primer on Algebra and Number Theory Fengyang Wang MC 4020 1730 Abstract This talk will quickly walk through the basics of group theory focusing especially on transformation groups If time permits we will cover some fundamentals of number theory Please message me in advance if there are any subjects in particular that you would like me to discuss AbelRuffini Theorem Akshay Tiwary MC 4020 1830 Abstract The AbelRuffini Theorem is a famous result that not all polynomials with degree five or greater admit roots that can be described with only the elementary functions and radicals This talk will prove the AbelRuffini through elementary means Talks on Wednesday October 12 2016 Ultrafilters Felix Bauckholt TBD 1730 Information Theory Sidhant Saraogi TBD 1830 Required reading for information theory Stirlings approximation PDF Talks on Friday October 14 2016 The Joy of Factoring Louis Castricato MC 4020 1730 Types and ObjectOriented Programming Nikita Kapustin MC 4020 1830 Talks on Friday October 21 2016 Category Theory Luthfi Mawarid MC 4020 1730 Quantum Computing Michael Pang MC 4020 1830 Talks on Friday October 28 2016 Hacking Rolina Wu MC 4020 1730 Integration Gregory Patchell MC 4020 1830 Talks on Friday November 4 2016 Game Theory Koosha Totonchi MC 4020 1730 Symmetric Groups Randy Lin MC 4020 1830 Talks on Friday November 11 2016 Graphs Surfaces and Homology Kai Rsch MC 4020 1730 Random Graphs and Complex Networks Frieda Rong MC 4020 1830 Talks on Friday November 18 2016 Hypercomplex Numbers Fengyang Wang MC 4020 1730 Elliptic Curves and Modular Forms Akshay Tiwary MC 4020 1830 Talks on Friday November 25 2016 Quandles Brennen CreightonYoung MC 4020 1730 Nave Lie Theory Aidan Patterson MC 4020 1830 Talks on Friday December 2 2016 Basic Harmonic Analysis Mohamed Ayman MC 4020 1730 Symmetries and Their Role in Physics Vasudev Shyam MC 4020 1830
